posts.cooked:
I have several hundred MBs (and growing) of conversation data, most of it due to media. I’ve disabled backups since I was worried about a daily erase/write cycle of what will soon be 1GB and more causing premature wear on the phone’s flash memory. I rely on remembering to enable and take a backup once a week or so, a backup frequency that’s fine with me.

Assuming that daily, times GBs of data is indeed a block erase tempo that could cause premature flash wear (happy to be given info that it’s not BTW), an option to reduce backup frequency would be really welcome. A related feature/option would be to periodically nag the user to take a fresh backup, similar to how PIN reminders work now, instead of a set frequency.

link_counts.title: Pause backups and allow different backup schedules

posts.cooked:
dimitris:

Assuming that daily, times GBs of data is indeed a block erase tempo that could cause premature flash wear (happy to be given info that it’s not BTW)

I don’t think it’s anything to worry about; it’s at most one additional program/erase cycle per day. You probably have other apps that do many more than that.

dimitris:

I have several hundred MBs

Weak. Mine is 3 GB. :P ;)

Thanks. I’m mostly asking because I’ve actually killed two Intel SSDs with a “let’s hibernate this 8GB RAM laptop around 5 times a day” duty cycle. Took around 2 years to go through first the new, then the replacement SSD.

My backup file size is about 18 GB. It’s so great to know that my chat history of the past 9 years is safe! I back it up locally in a folder of my Android phone and then let another app to back that folder up outside my phone.

But there’s certainly a problem. 18 GB write per day can’t be too good to my phone’s internal storage. And also several 18 GB files eat up space, since there’s no way to specify how many backup files to keep (or maybe there is but my phone runs out of space before any old file removal happens).

More control over backup frequency would solve so many issues.

spewx:

since there’s no way to specify how many backup files to keep (or maybe there is but my phone runs out of space before any old file removal happens

Yeah, I’d LOVE to be able to specify how many backup files should be kept, for exactly the same reason…

While they’re at it, they could (should) really add the proposed option for “number of backups to keep” to save space (yeah, I know, it’s a bit off-topic, but not that much)
What is the difference between “Signal Backups” and “Chat Backups”?

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: As it is now, Signal backups is the offline backup we have already. Including media. “Chat backups” is online at Signal’s (hired cloud) servers, has a paid option and I don’t know if it includes media. If it does it better be a incremental backup or data usage might explode.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It seems that they’re leveraging keeping media around for 30 days for the free tier.

posts.name: Jose Luis Malaquias
posts.cooked:
I was about to post a comment to the same effect.
Performing a 15GB (in my case) backup everyday is a bit overkill. It quickly fills my local memory, and it is too big to transfer over Wi-Fi, forcing me to connect via USB.
Three possible alternatives:
1-Allow us to reduce the frequency to, say, weekly or monthly.
2-Define the number of previous backups to keep before deleting old ones.
3-Performing an incremental backup where the existing backup is grown with the new content.

@CueHD @anon53652

Screenshot 1:
“Signal Backups” is the new setting (behind feature flag)
“Chat backups” is the old (local) setting

Screenshots 2 and 3 shows the new settings on the new “Signal Backups”.
Hint: Title is “Chat Backups”.
Maybe title is changed later (hopefully before released as stable)

@malaquias

See the first comment from me. MessageBackupsFrequency is selectable:
DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY

posts.name: Jose Luis Malaquias
posts.cooked: Great @Signal.DE . But how can I enable that feature flag? Do I need to compile the whole thing? Isn’t there a repository where I can find the compiled version?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Nothing is functional yet so you’ll need a bit more patience :)

posts.name: Jose Luis Malaquias
posts.cooked: Cool. Thank you. It’s great to know it’s being handled.

The new backup system that is now in public testing will change local backups to an incremental format which will largely solve this.

Public Signal Backups Testing Call for Testing
TL;DR You can test the new Signal Backups feature on Android on our staging servers. Grab the self-updating apk here! Hello, everyone! Many of you are aware that we’ve been working on a new end-to-end encrypted backup system for quite a while. Well, today, we’re finally ready to start testing it with external users The new backup system fulfills so many of the things people have wanted for so long: Hosted by Signal, so your data is safe even if you made a local back…
